poem:
Title: Hymns in Echo Chamber

Within the Workmen's Hall, the notes are struck,
A songbird, innocent in nature's plight.
Yet the echo calls: "Antisemite!" Such
is the thorn-pricked chorus of the night.
Church, conducting waves across the sea,
Holds the baton of dispute, her true intent.
Sings promise of a Gaza free, 
To be or not to be a lament.
